00129 /* HashFileID4 : creates a 16bits hash of the 64bits fileid4 buffer.
00130  *
00131  * @param fileid4 [IN] 64bits fileid to be hashed.
00132  */
00133 short HashFileID4( u_int64_t fileid4 )
00134 {  
00135   int i;  
00136   short hash_val = 0;
00137     
00138   for ( i = 0; i <= 56; i += 8 )
00139   {
00140 #define ALPHABET_LEN      16
00141 #define PRIME_16BITS   65521
00142     
00143     hash_val = ( hash_val * ALPHABET_LEN + ((fileid4 >> i) & 0xFF) ) % PRIME_16BITS;
00144   }
00145   
00146   return hash_val;
00147 }

00149  
00165 cache_content_status_t cache_content_create_name( char                     * path,
00166                                                   cache_content_nametype_t   type,
00167                                                   fsal_op_context_t        * pcontext,
00168                                                   cache_entry_t            * pentry_inode,
00169                                                   cache_content_client_t   * pclient )
00170 {
00171   fsal_status_t             fsal_status ;
00172   u_int64_t                 fileid4 ; /* Don't want to include nfs_prot.h at this level */
00173   fsal_handle_t           * pfsal_handle = NULL ;
00174   cache_inode_status_t      cache_status ;
00175   char                      entrydir[MAXPATHLEN];
00176   int                       i, nb_char;
00177   short                     hash_val;
00178   
00179   if( ( pfsal_handle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( pentry_inode, &cache_status ) ) == NULL )
00180     {
00181       /* stat */
00182       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00183       
00184       return CACHE_CONTENT_BAD_CACHE_INODE_ENTRY ;
00185     }
00186 
00187   /* Get the digest for the handle, for computing an entry name */
00188   fsal_status = FSAL_DigestHandle( pcontext->export_context,    
00189                                    FSAL_DIGEST_FILEID4 ,
00190                                    pfsal_handle,
00191                                    (caddr_t)&fileid4 ) ;
00192 
00193   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00194     return CACHE_CONTENT_FSAL_ERROR ;
00195   
00196 
00197   /* computes a 16bits hash of the 64bits fileid4 buffer */
00198   hash_val = HashFileID4( fileid4 );
00199     
00200   
00201   /* for limiting the number of entries into each datacache directory
00202    * we create 256 subdirectories on 2 levels, depending on the entry's fileid.
00203    */
00204   nb_char = snprintf( entrydir, MAXPATHLEN, "%s/export_id=%d",
00205                       pclient->cache_dir, 0 ) ;
00206   
00207   for ( i = 0; i <= 8 ; i += 8 )
00208   {
00209     /* concatenation of hashval */
00210     nb_char += snprintf( (char *)(entrydir + nb_char), MAXPATHLEN - nb_char,
00211                           "/%02hhX", (char)((hash_val >> i) & 0xFF) );
00212     
00213     /* creating the directory if necessary */
00214     if ( (mkdir( entrydir, 0750 ) != 0) && ( errno != EEXIST ) )
00215     {
00216       return CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR;
00217     }
00218   }  
00219   
00220   /* Create files for caching the entry: index file */
00221   switch( type )
00222     {
00223     case CACHE_CONTENT_DATA_FILE:
00224       snprintf( path, MAXPATHLEN, "%s/node=%llx.data", entrydir, (unsigned long long)fileid4 ) ;
00225       break ;
00226       
00227     case CACHE_CONTENT_INDEX_FILE:
00228       snprintf( path, MAXPATHLEN, "%s/node=%llx.index", entrydir, (unsigned long long)fileid4 ) ;
00229       break ;
00230 
00231     case CACHE_CONTENT_DIR:
00232       snprintf( path, 
00233                 MAXPATHLEN, 
00234                 "%s/export_id=%d", 
00235                 pclient->cache_dir, 
00236                 0 ) ;
00237       break ;
00238       
00239     default:
00240       return CACHE_CONTENT_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00241     }
00242   
00243   return CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00244 } /* cache_content_create_name */
00245 
00257 int cache_content_get_export_id( char * dirname )
00258 {
00259   int exportid ;
00260   
00261   if( strncmp( dirname, "export_id=", strlen( "export_id=" ) ) )
00262     return -1 ;
00263   
00264   if( sscanf( dirname, "export_id=%d", &exportid ) == 0 )
00265     return -1 ;
00266   else
00267     return exportid ;
00268 } /* cache_content_get_export_id */

00282 u_int64_t cache_content_get_inum( char * filename )
00283 {
00284   unsigned long long inum ;
00285   char buff[MAXNAMLEN];
00286   char * bname = NULL;
00287   
00288   /* splits the dirent->d_name into path and filename */
00289   strncpy( buff, filename, MAXNAMLEN );
00290   bname = basename( buff );  
00291   
00292   if( strncmp( bname, "node=", strlen( "node=" ) ) )
00293     return 0 ;
00294   
00295   if( strncmp( bname + strlen( bname ) -5, "index", NAME_MAX ) )
00296     return 0 ;
00297   
00298   if( sscanf( bname, "node=%llx.index", &inum ) == 0 )
00299     return 0 ;
00300   else
00301     return (u_int64_t)inum ;
00302 } /* cache_content_get_inum */
00303

00305 
00319 int cache_content_get_datapath( char * basepath, u_int64_t inum, char * datapath )
00320 {
00321    short       hash_val;
00322    
00323    hash_val = HashFileID4( inum );
00324 
00325    snprintf( datapath, MAXPATHLEN, "%s/%02hhX/%02hhX/node=%llx.data", basepath,
00326        (char)((hash_val) & 0xFF),
00327        (char)((hash_val >> 8) & 0xFF),
00328        (unsigned long long)inum ) ;
00329 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_CONTENT
00330   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "cache_content_get_datapath : datapath ----> %s", datapath ) ;
00331 #endif
00332 
00333    /* it is ok, we now return 0 */
00334   return 0;
00335 } /* cache_content_get_datapath */

00352 off_t cache_content_recover_size( char * basepath, u_int64_t inum )
00353 {
00354    char        path[MAXPATHLEN] ;
00355    struct stat buffstat ;
00356    
00357    cache_content_get_datapath( basepath, inum, path );
00358    
00359    if( stat( path, &buffstat ) !=0 )
00360      {  
00361         DisplayLog( "Failure in cache_content_recover_size while stat on local cache: path=%s errno = %u", path, errno ) ;
00362 
00363         return -1 ;
00364      }
00365 
00366 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_CONTENT
00367    DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "path ----> %s %llu\n", path, buffstat.st_size ) ;
00368 #endif
00369 
00370    /* Stat is ok, we now return the size */
00371   return buffstat.st_size ;
00372 } /* cache_content_recover_size */

00386 off_t cache_content_get_cached_size( cache_content_entry_t * pentry )
00387 {
00388    struct stat buffstat ;
00389 
00390    if( stat( pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data, &buffstat ) !=0 )
00391        {
00392         DisplayLog( "Failure in cache_content_get_cached_size while stat on local cache: path=%s errno = %u", 
00393                     pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_index, errno ) ;
00394 
00395         return -1 ;
00396      }
00397 
00398   /* Stat is ok, we now return the size */
00399 
00400   return buffstat.st_size ;
00401 
00402 } /* cache_content_get_cached_size */
00414 cache_inode_status_t cache_content_error_convert( cache_content_status_t status ) 
00415 {
00416   cache_inode_status_t converted_status ;
00417   
00418   switch( status )
00419     {
00420     case CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS:
00421       converted_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00422       break ;
00423       
00424     case CACHE_CONTENT_INVALID_ARGUMENT:
00425       converted_status = CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00426       break ;
00427       
00428     case CACHE_CONTENT_BAD_CACHE_INODE_ENTRY:
00429       converted_status = CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00430       break ;
00431       
00432     case CACHE_CONTENT_ENTRY_EXISTS:
00433       converted_status = CACHE_INODE_ENTRY_EXISTS ;
00434       break ;
00435       
00436     case  CACHE_CONTENT_FSAL_ERROR:
00437       converted_status = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ERROR ;
00438       break ;
00439       
00440     case CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR:
00441       converted_status = CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_ERROR ;
00442       break ;
00443       
00444     case CACHE_CONTENT_MALLOC_ERROR:
00445       converted_status = CACHE_INODE_MALLOC_ERROR  ;
00446       break ;
00447     
00448     case CACHE_CONTENT_LRU_ERROR:
00449       converted_status = CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR  ;
00450       break ;
00451 
00452     default:
00453       converted_status = CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00454       break ;
00455     }
00456   
00457   return converted_status ;
00458 } /* cache_content_error_convert */

00460 
00473 off_t cache_content_fsal_seek_convert( fsal_seek_t seek, cache_content_status_t * pstatus )
00474 {
00475   off_t offset = 0 ;
00476   
00477   if( seek.whence != FSAL_SEEK_SET )
00478     *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00479   else
00480     {
00481       *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00482       offset = (off_t)seek.offset ;
00483     }
00484   
00485   return offset ;
00486 } /* cache_content_fsal_seek_convert */

00500 size_t cache_content_fsal_size_convert( fsal_size_t size, cache_content_status_t * pstatus ) 
00501 {
00502   size_t taille ;
00503 
00504   *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00505   taille = (size_t)size ;
00506   
00507   return taille ;
00508 } /* cache_content_fsal_size_convert */
00509 
00522 cache_content_status_t cache_content_prepare_directories( exportlist_t           * pexportlist, 
00523                                                           char                   * cache_dir,
00524                                                           cache_content_status_t * pstatus  ) 
00525 {
00526   exportlist_t * pexport = NULL  ;
00527   char           cache_sub_dir[MAXPATHLEN] ;
00528   
00529   /* Does the cache root directory exist ? */
00530   if( access( cache_dir, F_OK ) == -1 )
00531     {
00532       /* Create the cache root directory */
00533       if( mkdir( cache_dir, 0750 ) == -1 )
00534         return CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00535     }
00536 
00537   /* Create the sub directories if needed */
00538   for( pexport = pexportlist ; pexport != NULL ; pexport = pexport->next )
00539     {
00540       /* Create a directory only if the export entry is to be datya cached */
00541       if( pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_USE_DATACACHE )
00542         {
00543           snprintf( cache_sub_dir, MAXPATHLEN, "%s/export_id=%d",  cache_dir, 0 ) ;
00544           
00545           if( access( cache_sub_dir, F_OK ) == -1 )
00546             {
00547               /* Create the cache  directory */
00548               if( mkdir( cache_sub_dir, 0750 ) == -1 )
00549                 return CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00550             }
00551         }
00552     }
00553   
00554   /* If this point is reached, everything went ok */
00555   return CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00556 } /* cache_content_prepare_directories */
00557 
00558 
00574 cache_content_status_t cache_content_valid( cache_content_entry_t *  pentry,
00575                                             cache_inode_op_t         op,
00576                                             cache_content_client_t * pclient )
00577 {
00578   /* /!\ NOTE THIS CAREFULLY: entry is supposed to be locked when this function is called !! */
00579 
00580 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM
00581   buddy_stats_t  __attribute__(( __unused__ ))      bstats;
00582 #endif
00583 
00584   if( pentry == NULL )
00585     return CACHE_CONTENT_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00586 
00587   /* Update internal md */
00588   pentry->internal_md.valid_state = VALID ;
00589 
00590   switch( op ) 
00591    {
00592         case CACHE_CONTENT_OP_GET:
00593            pentry->internal_md.read_time = time( NULL ) ;
00594            break ;
00595 
00596         case CACHE_CONTENT_OP_SET:
00597            pentry->internal_md.mod_time = time( NULL ) ;
00598            pentry->internal_md.refresh_time = pentry->internal_md.mod_time ;
00599            pentry->local_fs_entry.sync_state = FLUSH_NEEDED ;
00600            break ;
00601 
00602         case CACHE_CONTENT_OP_FLUSH:
00603            pentry->internal_md.mod_time = time( NULL ) ;
00604            pentry->internal_md.refresh_time = pentry->internal_md.mod_time ;
00605            pentry->local_fs_entry.sync_state = SYNC_OK ;
00606            break ;
00607    }
00608 
00609   return  CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00610 } /* cache_content_valid */
00611 
00612 
00613 
00633 cache_content_status_t cache_content_check_threshold( char          * datacache_path,
00634                                                       unsigned int    threshold_min,
00635                                                       unsigned int    threshold_max,
00636                                                       int           * p_bool_overflow,
00637                                                       unsigned long * p_blocks_to_lwm )
00638 {
00639   char fspath[MAXPATHLEN];
00640 #ifdef _SOLARIS
00641   struct statvfs info_fs;
00642 #else
00643   struct statfs info_fs;
00644 #endif 
00645   unsigned long total_user_blocs, dispo_hw, dispo_lw;
00646   double tx_used, hw, lw;
00647   
00648   /* defensive checks */
00649   
00650   if ( !datacache_path || !p_bool_overflow || !p_blocks_to_lwm
00651       || (threshold_min>threshold_max) || (threshold_max > 100) )
00652       return CACHE_CONTENT_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00653     
00654   /* cross mountpoint */  
00655   
00656   snprintf(fspath, MAXPATHLEN ,"%s/.", datacache_path );
00657   
00658   /* retieve FS info */
00659   
00660   if ( statfs(fspath, &info_fs) != 0 )
00661   {
00662         DisplayLog( "Error getting local filesystem info: path=%s errno=%u\n", fspath, errno );
00663     return CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00664   }
00665   
00666   /* Compute thresholds and total block count.
00667    * Those formulas are based on the df's code:
00668    * used = f_blocks - available_to_root
00669    *      = f_blocks - f_bfree
00670    * total = used + available
00671    *       = f_blocks - f_bfree + f_bavail
00672    */
00673   hw = (double)threshold_max; /* cast to double */
00674   lw = (double)threshold_min; /* cast to double */
00675   
00676   total_user_blocs = ( info_fs.f_blocks + info_fs.f_bavail - info_fs.f_bfree );
00677   dispo_hw = (unsigned long) ((( 100.0 - hw ) * total_user_blocs ) / 100.0 );
00678   dispo_lw = (unsigned long) ((( 100.0 - lw ) * total_user_blocs ) / 100.0 );
00679   
00680   tx_used = 100.0 * ((double)info_fs.f_blocks-(double)info_fs.f_bfree) /
00681              ((double)info_fs.f_blocks+(double)info_fs.f_bavail-(double)info_fs.f_bfree);
00682     
00683   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Datacache: %s: %.2f%% used, low_wm = %.2f%%, high_wm = %.2f%%",
00684                    datacache_path, tx_used, lw, hw );
00685   
00686   /* threshold test */
00687   
00688   /* if the threshold is under high watermark, nothing to do */
00689   
00690   if ( tx_used < hw )
00691   {
00692     *p_bool_overflow = FALSE;
00693     *p_blocks_to_lwm = 0;
00694     DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Datacache: no purge needed" );
00695   }
00696   else
00697   {
00698     *p_bool_overflow = TRUE;
00699     *p_blocks_to_lwm = dispo_lw - info_fs.f_bavail;
00700     DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Datacache: need to purge %lu blocks for reaching low WM", *p_blocks_to_lwm );
00701   }
00702   
00703   return CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS;  
00704   
00705 }                                                      
00706 
00716 int cache_content_local_cache_opendir( char * cache_dir, cache_content_dirinfo_t * pdirectory )
00717 {
00718   pdirectory->level0_dir = NULL ;
00719   pdirectory->level1_dir = NULL ;
00720   pdirectory->level2_dir = NULL ;
00721   pdirectory->level1_cnt = 0 ;
00722   pdirectory->cookie0    = NULL ;
00723   pdirectory->cookie1    = NULL ;
00724   pdirectory->cookie2    = NULL ;
00725   strcpy(  pdirectory->level0_path, "" ) ;
00726   strcpy(  pdirectory->level1_name, "" ) ;
00727   strcpy(  pdirectory->level2_name, "" ) ;
00728 
00729   /* opens the top level directory */
00730   if( ( pdirectory->level0_dir = opendir( cache_dir )) == NULL )
00731    {
00732     cache_content_dir_errno = errno ;
00733     return FALSE ;
00734    }
00735   else
00736   {
00737     cache_content_dir_errno = 0 ;
00738     strncpy( pdirectory->level0_path, cache_dir, MAXPATHLEN );
00739   }
00740 
00741   pdirectory->level1_cnt = 0;
00742   return TRUE ;
00743 } /* cache_content_local_cache_opendir */
00744 
00745 
00760 cache_content_status_t cache_content_test_cached( cache_entry_t                 * pentry_inode,
00761                                                   cache_content_client_t        * pclient,
00762                                                   fsal_op_context_t             * pcontext,
00763                                                   cache_content_status_t        * pstatus ) 
00764 {
00765   char                   cache_path_index[MAXPATHLEN] ;
00766 
00767   if( pstatus == NULL )
00768     return CACHE_CONTENT_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00769 
00770   if( pentry_inode == NULL || pclient == NULL || pcontext == NULL )
00771     {
00772         *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00773         return *pstatus ;
00774     }
00775 
00776   /* Build the cache index path */
00777   if( ( *pstatus = cache_content_create_name( cache_path_index,
00778                                               CACHE_CONTENT_INDEX_FILE,
00779                                               pcontext,
00780                                               pentry_inode, 
00781                                               pclient ) ) != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
00782         {
00783            return  *pstatus ;
00784         }
00785   
00786 
00787    /* Check if the file exists */ 
00788    if( access( cache_path_index, F_OK ) == 0 )
00789     {
00790       /* File is accessible and exists */
00791       *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00792       return CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00793     }
00794 
00795    /* No access */ 
00796    *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_NOT_FOUND ;
00797    return CACHE_CONTENT_NOT_FOUND ;
00798 
00799 } /* cache_content_test_cached */
00800 
00801 
00813 int cache_content_local_cache_dir_iter( cache_content_dirinfo_t * directory,
00814                                         struct dirent           * pdir_entry,
00815                                         unsigned int              index,
00816                                         unsigned int              mod )
00817 {
00818     int rc_readdir = 0 ;
00819 
00820     /* sanity check */
00821     if ( directory == NULL || pdir_entry == NULL )
00822     {
00823       cache_content_dir_errno = EFAULT;
00824       return FALSE ;
00825     }
00826 
00827     do {
00828       
00829       errno = 0;
00830             
00831       /* if the lowest level directory is not opened,
00832        * proceed a readdir, on the topper level directory,
00833        * and so on.
00834        */
00835       if ( directory->level2_dir != NULL )
00836       {
00837         rc_readdir = readdir_r( directory->level2_dir, pdir_entry, &(directory->cookie2) ) ;
00838 
00839         if( rc_readdir == 0 && directory->cookie2 != NULL ) 
00840         {
00841           char d_name_save[MAXNAMLEN];
00842         
00843  
00844           /* go to the next loop if the entry is . or .. */
00845            if( !strcmp( ".", pdir_entry->d_name ) || !strcmp( "..", pdir_entry->d_name )  ) 
00846              continue; 
00847       
00848 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_CONTENT
00849           printf( "iterator --> %s/%s/%s/%s\n",directory->level0_path,
00850                   directory->level1_name, directory->level2_name,
00851                   pdir_entry->d_name );
00852 #endif
00853 
00854           /* the d_name must actually be the relative path from
00855            * the cache directory path, so that a file can be
00856            * accessed using <rootpath>/<d_name> path.
00857            */
00858           strncpy( d_name_save, pdir_entry->d_name, MAXNAMLEN );
00859           snprintf( pdir_entry->d_name, MAXNAMLEN, "%s/%s/%s",
00860               directory->level1_name, directory->level2_name, d_name_save );
00861           
00862           return TRUE;
00863         }
00864         else
00865         {
00866           /* test if it is an error or an end of dir */
00867           if ( errno != 0 )
00868           {
00869             cache_content_dir_errno = errno;
00870             return TRUE;
00871           }
00872           else
00873           {
00874             /* the lowest level entry dir is finished,
00875              * must proceed a readdir on the topper level
00876              */
00877             closedir( directory->level2_dir ); 
00878             directory->level2_dir = NULL;
00879             /* go to next loop */
00880           }
00881         }
00882       }
00883       /* continue directory at level 1 */
00884       else if ( directory->level1_dir != NULL )
00885       {
00886         if ( mod <= 1 )
00887         {
00888           /* list all dirs */
00889           rc_readdir = readdir_r( directory->level1_dir , pdir_entry, &(directory->cookie1) ) ;
00890           directory->level1_cnt += 1;          
00891         }
00892         else
00893         {
00894           rc_readdir = readdir_r( directory->level1_dir, pdir_entry, &(directory->cookie1) ) ;
00895           directory->level1_cnt ++;
00896 
00897 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_CONTENT
00898           printf( "---> directory->level1_cnt=%u mod=%u index=%u modulocalcule=%u name=%s\n",
00899                   directory->level1_cnt, mod, index, directory->level1_cnt % mod, pdir_entry->d_name ) ;
00900 #endif
00901  
00902           /* skip entry if  cnt % mod == index */
00903           if ( ( directory->level1_cnt % mod != index ) )
00904             continue;
00905         }
00906 
00907         if( rc_readdir == 0  && directory->cookie1 != NULL )
00908         {
00909           char dirpath[MAXPATHLEN];
00910               
00911           /* go to the next loop if this is the . or .. entry */
00912           if ( !strcmp( ".", pdir_entry->d_name ) || !strcmp( "..", pdir_entry->d_name ) )
00913             continue;
00914           
00915           strncpy( directory->level2_name, pdir_entry->d_name, MAXNAMLEN );
00916           
00917           /* must now open the entry as the level2 directory */
00918           snprintf ( dirpath, MAXPATHLEN, "%s/%s/%s", 
00919                      directory->level0_path,
00920                      directory->level1_name,
00921                      directory->level2_name ); 
00922           
00923           if( ( directory->level2_dir = opendir( dirpath )) == NULL )
00924           {
00925             cache_content_dir_errno = errno ;
00926             return FALSE ;
00927           }
00928         }
00929         else
00930         {
00931           /* test if it is an error or an end of dir */
00932           if ( errno != 0 )
00933           {
00934             cache_content_dir_errno = errno;
00935             return TRUE;
00936           }
00937           else
00938           {
00939             /* the lowest level entry dir is finished,
00940              * must proceed a readdir on the topper level
00941              */
00942             closedir( directory->level1_dir );            
00943             directory->level1_dir = NULL;
00944           }
00945         }
00946       }
00947       /* continue directory at level 0 */
00948       else if ( directory->level0_dir != NULL )
00949       {
00950 
00951         rc_readdir = readdir_r( directory->level0_dir, pdir_entry, &(directory->cookie0 ) ) ;
00952 
00953         if( rc_readdir == 0 && directory->cookie0 != NULL ) 
00954         {
00955           char dirpath[MAXPATHLEN];
00956               
00957           /* go to the next loop if this is the . or .. entry */
00958           if ( !strcmp( ".", pdir_entry->d_name ) || !strcmp( "..", pdir_entry->d_name ) )
00959             continue;
00960           
00961           strncpy( directory->level1_name, pdir_entry->d_name, MAXNAMLEN );
00962           
00963           /* must now open the entry as the level1 directory */
00964           snprintf ( dirpath, MAXPATHLEN, "%s/%s", 
00965                      directory->level0_path,
00966                      directory->level1_name );
00967           
00968           directory->level1_cnt = 0;
00969           
00970           if( ( directory->level1_dir = opendir( dirpath )) == NULL )
00971           {
00972             cache_content_dir_errno = errno ;
00973             return TRUE;
00974           }          
00975         }
00976         else 
00977         {
00978           /* test if it is an error or an end of dir */
00979           if ( errno != 0 )
00980           {
00981             cache_content_dir_errno = errno;
00982             return TRUE;
00983           }
00984           else
00985           {
00986             /* we are at the end of the level directory
00987              * return End of Dir
00988              */
00989             cache_content_dir_errno = 0;
00990             return FALSE;
00991           }
00992         }
00993       }
00994       else
00995       {
00996         /* invalid base directory descriptor */
00997         cache_content_dir_errno = EINVAL;
00998         return TRUE;        
00999       }
01000       
01001     } while ( 1 );
01002         
01003     cache_content_dir_errno = -1 ;
01004     /* should never happen */
01005     return TRUE ;
01006     
01007 } /* cache_content_local_cache_dir_iter */
01008 
01009 
01010 
01020 void cache_content_local_cache_closedir( cache_content_dirinfo_t * directory )
01021 {
01022   if ( directory != NULL)
01023   {
01024     if ( directory->level2_dir != NULL )
01025     {
01026       closedir( directory->level2_dir ) ;
01027       directory->level2_dir = NULL ;
01028     }
01029     
01030     if ( directory->level1_dir != NULL )
01031     {
01032       closedir( directory->level1_dir ) ;
01033       directory->level1_dir = NULL ;
01034     }
01035     
01036     if ( directory->level0_dir != NULL )
01037     {
01038       closedir( directory->level0_dir ) ;
01039       directory->level0_dir = NULL ;
01040     }
01041   }
01042 } /* cache_content_local_cache_closedir */
01043
Generated on Tue Mar 31 14:37:35 2009 for File Content layer by  1.5.7.1
